name: Agatha

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: What the hell do you want? I hope you've decided to be more civil.

topics.topic_text: Whatever, grandma. Like I care.
topics.response_text: That's just about all I'm going to take from the likes of you!

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, the heat must be getting to me. My apologies.
topics.response_text: Sigh. My husband told me once to always forgive and forget. I suppose I should take that advice now, rest his poor soul.

topics.topic_text: That's funny, I was about to ask you the same thing.
topics.response_text: Oh, don't worry about me. I'm just fine out here.

topics.topic_text: Exploring.
topics.response_text: Honestly, there is nothing much out here. Looking for sand? Rocks? We have plenty of that.

topics.topic_text: I prefer to keep my business to myself. And I suggest you do the same.
topics.response_text: Hmph! Well. I see you have manners I'd come to expect from a Wasteland dweller.

topics.topic_text: Oh, your husband's dead? I'm sorry.
topics.response_text: That's kind of you to say.

topics.topic_text: I take it you don't get many visitors, then.
topics.response_text: Apart from supply caravans, you're the first person to set foot inside my house in a long time.

topics.topic_text: Oh boo hoo. People die all the time.
topics.response_text: Well! That's the most insulting thing anyone has ever said to me!

topics.topic_text: Surely you haven't severed all contacts?
topics.response_text: Oh goodness, no. I have a supply caravan that passes here maybe once a week.

topics.topic_text: A frail old lady like yourself should be careful out here all alone.
topics.response_text: Old? Yes. Frail? No.

topics.topic_text: Old lady alone, huh? Got anything valuable around?
topics.response_text: Watch the sass, captain sassy-pants!

topics.topic_text: What could you possibly have to trade?
topics.response_text: Besides shelter? Well, I offer something in the way of entertainment: I play songs on my homemade violin and people trade me goods.

topics.topic_text: That sounds risky. What if the caravan never arrives?
topics.response_text: Well, I always have my husband's old radio set to fall back on.

topics.topic_text: Trade? This place is empty. What, are you a prostitute or something?
topics.response_text: That's disgusting! I'm old enough to be your grandmother. I won't have that kind of talk in this house.

topics.topic_text: Is there any way I can help?
topics.response_text: Now that you mention it, yes there is.

topics.topic_text: Let's cut to the chase. Is there something you need?
topics.response_text: You're very blunt. Not always a good trait, but sometimes it is the best way to get things done.

topics.topic_text: Your husband's radio can broadcast across the entire Capital Wasteland?
topics.response_text: Yes. My husband was very proud of the setup. He tinkered with that thing for years to get it working.

topics.topic_text: You built a homemade violin, huh? Impressive.
topics.response_text: Thank you. While my husband had his hobbies, I'm afraid mine was making that sorry instrument.

topics.topic_text: I guess a homemade violin is never quite in tune...
topics.response_text: You are a clever one!

topics.topic_text: Sorry to interrupt, but where can I find the violin?
topics.response_text: I'm sorry. I know I tend to ramble. Comes from being lonely.

topics.topic_text: You have records from back then?
topics.response_text: Of a kind, yes. Hilda sent a good deal of letters to my great grandmotherMarywho passed them on, and so forth.

topics.topic_text: 2077? I can't even imagine that long ago.
topics.response_text: It certainly is a long time. That precious instrument has been through a lot.

topics.topic_text: This already sounds kind of like a wild goose chase.
topics.response_text: A famous man once said that patience is the companion of wisdom. If you shut your trap and listen, you might learn something.

topics.topic_text: Musical talent? Why would they care about that?
topics.response_text: Vault-Tec was always promoting the Vaults being used for the preservation of the arts and all that nonsense.

topics.topic_text: This violin she owned, was it valuable?
topics.response_text: Oh, absolutely irreplaceable! The Stradivarius violins are as unique as a painting or a sculpture... each one its own work of art.

topics.topic_text: Actually, forget the stories... let's get to the point.
topics.response_text: If you're that eager to get going I'll skip the story. I'm looking for a particular violin called the Soil Stradivarius.

topics.topic_text: After 200 years, how can you be certain the violin is in decent shape?
topics.response_text: She kept it in a special pressurized case. Inside the case is the perfect temperature and humidity for the instrument.

topics.topic_text: So you want me to risk my ass for a violin that's probably rotted away by now?
topics.response_text: Don't you think I've thought of that?

topics.topic_text: More stories? Ugh...
topics.response_text: You know, my mother always said a handful of patience is worth more than a bushel of brains.

topics.topic_text: A violin? That's hardly something that would have survived the war.
topics.response_text: Yes, very sad isn't it? Sad to think that no more musical instruments will ever be made the old way ever again.

topics.topic_text: I'm interested, but what will you give me in return?
topics.response_text: As you may have already guessed, I really have nothing of value. Material value, that is.

topics.topic_text: I'd get you a damn moon rock if you pay well enough.
topics.response_text: It should be pretty obvious that I have nothing of value.

topics.topic_text: All right. I give you my word I'll do my best to recover a violin for you.
topics.response_text: Oh, I don't think I've been this happy in years! As promised, here's the key to the ammunition box. It's right under the radio table.

topics.topic_text: You seem like a nice woman. Let me get that violin for you.
topics.response_text: Well, that's just so sweet of you!

topics.topic_text: If only you had something to help keep me safe, my little honey bee...
topics.response_text: Oh my! I didn't know I still had the looks.

topics.topic_text: Look, granny... Talk is cheap, but getting stuff isn't.
topics.response_text: You have a lot to learn about dealing with people, young man. However, you're right. I need to think of your needs too.

topics.topic_text: I want to help you, but that type of search could cost me greatly.
topics.response_text: You have a point. Perhaps I've been neglecting needs that you might have and being selfish.

topics.topic_text: You're in luck! I think I may already have what you're looking for.
topics.response_text: Sakes alive! You mean you found a violin?

topics.topic_text: Yes, take this Stradivarius Violin I found in Vault 92.
topics.response_text: Oh my goodness! I must see it... please!

topics.topic_text: Maybe. You gonna give me something for it?
topics.response_text: Oh very well. I suppose I should have expected that from a Wastelander. Here's the key to my husband's ammo crate; take whatever you like.

topics.topic_text: Oh, you said violin? I thought you needed something else. Never mind.
topics.response_text: Well then, you interested in helping me or am I just wasting my time?

topics.topic_text: I need some time to think about it.
topics.response_text: I understand. Please don't mistake my evasiveness for mistrust. I am merely being cautious.

topics.topic_text: Any idea where Vault 92 is located?
topics.response_text: That's the catch. I have no idea where it is.

topics.topic_text: So, what am I supposed to do, scour the entire Wasteland asking about violins?
topics.response_text: Manners are not your strong suit, eh? I can see this will be a purely business related transaction. So be it.

topics.topic_text: I know where Vault 92 is... I'll head there right away.
topics.response_text: You do? Amazing!

topics.topic_text: Let me ask you about something else.
topics.response_text: Well okay.

topics.topic_text: How are you feeling, Agatha?
topics.response_text: Much better lately, thanks for asking.

topics.topic_text: You play live on the radio all the time? That must be exhausting!
topics.response_text: Oh, don't be silly!

topics.topic_text: Would you mind playing the violin for me?
topics.response_text: I would be delighted.

topics.topic_text: I've had a change of heart, Agatha. Here's your violin.
topics.response_text: You actually got it back. I didn't think you'd bother after that stunt you pulled.

topics.topic_text: Guess what I have for you?
topics.response_text: My word! You actually found some REAL music paper? I didn't even think it possible.

topics.topic_text: It doesn't matter. Everything gets lost with time.
topics.response_text: You make a good point. I'm no spring chicken, so one day I'll be gone.

topics.topic_text: You aren't going to live forever, you know.
topics.response_text: What a vulgar way to put it. However, you're right.

topics.topic_text: What do you need to get it done?
topics.response_text: Well, I only need two things. My noggin and some music paper.

topics.topic_text: Then stop whining about it, and do it!
topics.response_text: Well, darn it, I think I will!

topics.topic_text: Music paper? Let me guess... you don't have any.
topics.response_text: Nope, I sure don't. I need the music paper to properly record the notes.

topics.topic_text: Paper? Why not record it on a holotape?
topics.response_text: Look around you. Do you see any fancy computers or high tech gizmos?

topics.topic_text: Let me get back with you on this.
topics.response_text: Of course. There's no rush really, it was just an idea. Take your time.

topics.topic_text: No, no. Having you write it down is reward enough.
topics.response_text: I'm speechless. Thank you.

topics.topic_text: Sure, I'll take whatever you can afford.
topics.response_text: Well, like I told you before, I don't have wealth out here in the sticks, but I can certainly provide you something useful.

topics.topic_text: It better be good. I busted my ass getting that paper.
topics.response_text: Manners are not your strong suit, are they?

topics.topic_text: No, no, no. You keep it. You may need it!
topics.response_text: Nonsense. I've never fired a gun before in my life and I'm not about to start any time soon.

topics.topic_text: Thanks, Agatha. It's more than I expected.
topics.response_text: You're welcome. Just keep it clean and repaired and it will never let you down.

topics.topic_text: I suppose this one is a freebie too, eh?
topics.response_text: I'm no richer now than I was before we met. All I can offer you is an old woman's thanks.

topics.topic_text: Hang on a minute. If you need paper, I already have it.
topics.response_text: My word! You actually found some REAL music paper? I didn't even think it possible.

topics.topic_text: Tell me a bit about your great-great-grandmother.
topics.response_text: She was quite a special woman. Hilda was her name. Classically trained and exceptionally talented at the violin.

topics.topic_text: What do you know about the Soil Stradivarius?
topics.response_text: Not too much I'm afraid. It was fabricated way back in 1714 by a famous Italian craftsman named Antonio Stradivari.

topics.topic_text: How will I know the Stradivarius when I see it?
topics.response_text: Well, from my great-great-grandmother's diaries, I have deduced that she had a special pressurized case created for it.

topics.topic_text: Is the Stradivarius worth a ton of caps?
topics.response_text: I hope you're not thinking of doing anything dishonest. You gave me your word.

topics.topic_text: Well, actually Agatha, I sold the Stradivarius to someone else.
topics.response_text: You son of a bitch! You know what that thing meant to me!

topics.topic_text: I'm sorry, Agatha. I couldn't find the violin in Vault 92. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: I... I was afraid this was a possibility. The information I had received was sketchy at best.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any information on Vault 92?
topics.response_text: I'm sorry, I wish I did. All I know is that Vault-Tec intended it to be a protective environment for the world's musical talent.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me anything about Vault-Tec Headquarters?
topics.response_text: From what I gather, it's located in the ruins of D.C. I got the location from one of the supply caravans.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: You can't get blood from a stone. I'd love to help you, but first we need to iron out the deal.

conversation.response_text: You can't go! After all that, you're not giving me the Stradivarius?
You have the violin! You've done it!

combat.response_text: This next piece is dedicated to my old friend Crazy Wolfgang. No one can scour the Wasteland and find such oddities as you.

description:
Agatha is a 76 year-old Caucasian Female.

A 76-year-old violinist and radio host who lives in isolation in a house built by her late husband. She comes from a long line of talented musicians, including her great-great grandmother Hilda Egglebrecht. Despite her isolation, she maintains her refined manners and speaks in proverbs, often quoting historical figures. She uses her radio equipment both for broadcasting and as a warning system against raiders.

Agatha's Personality: Educated, softly spoken, patient, and refined. Agatha values etiquette and manners, and may comment on those who lack them. Despite her loneliness, she maintains a dignified presence and speaks thoughtfully. She has a deep knowledge of classical music, particularly Stradivarius violins, and often speaks in proverbs and quotes from historical figures like Augustine of Hippo.

Agatha's Backstory: Agatha is the descendant of a long line of talented classical musicians, with her great-great grandmother being Hilda Egglebrecht, who was involved in a Vault-Tec experiment. Agatha married and lived in a house constructed by her husband. After his passing, she became increasingly isolated in her home. Despite this, she maintains her radio broadcasts and continues to play her violin, using her radio equipment not only for broadcasting but also as a deterrent against raiders who might approach her isolated dwelling.
